[[EMET Prize]] (2006)
Rothschild Prize (2010) | signature = | repec_prefix = e | repec_id = pru8 }} '''Ariel Rubinstein''' ([[Hebrew]]: אריאל רובינשטיין) (born April 13, 1951) is an Israeli [[economist]] who works in Economic Theory, [[Game Theory]] and [[Bounded Rationality]] . ==Biography== Ariel Rubinstein studied mathematics and economics at the [[Hebrew University of Jerusalem]], 1972–1979. He is a professor of economics at the School of Economics at [[Tel Aviv University]] and the Department of Economics at [[New York University]]. In 1982, he published "Perfect equilibrium in a bargaining model",{{cite journal | author = Rubinstein, Ariel | year = 1982 | title = Perfect Equilibrium in a Bargaining Model | journal = [[Econometrica]] | volume = 50 | issue = 1 | pages = 97–109 | doi = 10.2307/1912531 | url = http://arielrubinstein.tau.ac.il/papers/11.pdf | jstor = 1912531 }} an important contribution to the theory of [[bargaining]]. The model is known also as a [[Rubinstein bargaining model]]. It describes two-person bargaining as an extensive game with [[perfect information]] in which the players alternate offers. A key assumption is that the players are impatient. The main result gives conditions under which the game has a unique [[subgame perfect equilibrium]] and characterizes this equilibrium. He also co-wrote ''A Course in Game Theory'' (1994) with Martin J. Osborne, a textbook that has been cited in excess of 5,300 times as of March 2014.http://scholar.google.com/citations?user=sCccieYAAAAJ&hl=en ==Honours and awards== Rubinstein was elected a member of the [[Israel Academy of Sciences and Humanities]] (1995),{{cite web|url=http://www.academy.ac.il/|title=Prof. Rubinstein Ariel Member Information (Election year 1995)|publisher=Israel Academy of Sciences and Humanities|accessdate=27 May 2013}} a Foreign Honorary Member of the [[American Academy of Arts and Sciences]] in (1994){{cite web|title=Book of Members, 1780–2010: Chapter R|url=http://www.amacad.org/publications/BookofMembers/ChapterR.pdf|publisher=American Academy of Arts and Sciences|accessdate=3 June 2011| archiveurl= http://web.archive.org/web/20110613085847/http://www.amacad.org/publications/BookofMembers/ChapterR.pdf| archivedate= 13 June 2011 | deadurl= no}} and the [[American Economic Association]] (1995). In 1985 he was elected a fellow of the [[Econometric Society]],[http://www.econometricsociety.org/fellows.asp Welcome to the website of The Econometric Society An International Society for the Advancement of Economic Theory in its Relation to Statistics and Mathematics] and served as its president in 2004.[http://www.econometricsociety.org/pastpres.asp Welcome to the website of The Econometric Society An International Society for the Advancement of Economic Theory in its Relation to Statistics and Mathematics] In 2002, he was awarded an honorary doctorate by the [[Tilburg University]].[http://www.tilburguniversity.nl/university/achievements/doctorates/2002/rubinstein/ Tilburg University - Prof. Ariel Rubinstein] He has received the Bruno Prize (2000), the [[Israel Prize]] for economics (2002),{{Cite web| title = Israel Prize Official Site (in Hebrew) – Recipient’s C.V. | url = http://cms.education.gov.il/EducationCMS/Units/PrasIsrael/Tashsab/ArielRubinshtein/KorotHaimPropesorArielRobibstayn.htm}}{{Cite web| title = Israel Prize Official Site (in Hebrew) – Judges' Rationale for Grant to Recipient | url = http://cms.education.gov.il/EducationCMS/Units/PrasIsrael/Tashsab/ArielRubinshtein/NimokyHsoftim.htm}} the [[Nemmers Prize in Economics]] (2004),[http://www.northwestern.edu/provost/awards/nemmers/ Nemmers Prizes, Awards, Office of the Provost, Northwestern University][http://www.northwestern.edu/provost/awards/nemmers/nemprecon.html#rubinstein The presentation of Ariel Rubinstein for the 2004 Nemmers Prize in Economics.] the [[EMET Prize]] (2006).http://www.emetprize.org.il/Index.asp?ArticleID=159&CategoryID=123&Page=1 and the Rothschild Prize (2010).http://www.yadhanadiv.org.il/fellowship-prize/rothschild-prize ==Published works== * [http://gametheory.tau.ac.il/arielDocs/ ''Bargaining and Markets''], with Martin J. Osborne, [[Academic Press]] 1990 * [http://gametheory.tau.ac.il/arielDocs/ ''A Course in Game Theory''], with Martin J. Osborne, [[MIT Press]], 1994. * [http://gametheory.tau.ac.il/arielDocs/ ''Modeling Bounded Rationality''], [[MIT Press]], 1998. * [http://gametheory.tau.ac.il/arielDocs/ ''Economics and Language''], [[Cambridge University Press]], 2000. * [http://gametheory.tau.ac.il/arielDocs/ ''Lecture Notes in Microeconomic Theory: The Economic Agent''], [[Princeton University Press]], 2006. * [http://gametheory.tau.ac.il/arielDocs/ ''Economic Fables''], OpenBook Publishers, 2012. * [http://arielrubinstein.tau.ac.il/agadot_hakalkala_ariel_rubinstein.pdf ''AGADOT HAKALKALA (heb.)''], Kineret, Zmora, Bitan, 2009. ==See also== * [[List of Israel Prize recipients]] ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== * [http://arielrubinstein.tau.ac.il/ Personal Web site] * [http://arielrubinstein.tau.ac.il/nash-lecture/nash-lecture.html Nash lecture] * {{cite web |last=Roberts |first=Russ |title=Rubinstein on Game Theory and Behavioral Economics |url=http://www.econtalk.org/archives/_featuring/ariel_rubinstei/ |work=[[EconTalk]] |publisher=[[Library of Economics and Liberty]] |authorlink=Russ Roberts |date=April 25, 2011}} {{Authority control}} {{Persondata | NAME = Rubinstein, Ariel | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION =Israeli economist | DATE OF BIRTH = April 13, 1951 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Jerusalem]], [[Israel]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Rubinstein, Ariel}} [[Category:1951 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Israeli economists]] [[Category:Game theorists]] [[Category:Israel Prize in economics recipients]] [[Category:Fellows of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences]] [[Category:Fellows of the British Academy]] [[Category:Fellows of the Econometric Society]] [[Category:Tel Aviv University faculty]] [[Category:Presidents of the Econometric Society]] [[Category:Members of the Israel Academy of Sciences and Humanities]] [[Category:Members of the European Academy of Sciences and Arts]]
